sentences.sContent: His nephew is an uncouth young man.
sentences.sContent_eng: His nephew is an uncouth young man.
sentences.sCn: 他的侄子是一个粗野的年轻人。

sentences.sContent: He made the most uncouth and clumsy gestures of delight.
sentences.sContent_eng: He made the most uncouth and clumsy gestures of delight.
sentences.sCn: 他做出的表示快乐的动作也是极笨拙、极难看的。

sentences.sContent: We do have the odd barbarian as below who need to release his uncouth behavior as a result of acute servility .
sentences.sContent_eng: We do have the odd barbarian as below who need to release his uncouth behavior as a result of acute servility .
sentences.sCn: 我们确实有象楼下那样的异类野蛮人， 他们要发泄因极度奴性引起的粗野行为。

synos.tran: 笨拙的；粗野的；不舒适的；陌生的

trans.tranOther: behaving and speaking in a way that is rude or socially unacceptable
